attributes.action: Stop educational institutes in the UK from sending farm animals off to slaughter
attributes.background: It has come to our attention that some educational institutes in the UK such as colleges that teach Land-based courses are raising farm animals to be slaughtered for meat. Enough animals in the UK are being farmed for meat and the practice is simply unnecessary. What do the students gain from this?
attributes.additional_details: Some students at the colleges who carry out this practice have been affected and none of the students were aware of the practice before signing up for Land-based courses. A parent of a student who suffered the same trauma of raising animals destined for the slaughterhouse quoted: “We don’t agree that this is how animals should be treated - especially at a learning facility." There are also many viable alternatives for the animals raised such as being released to a sanctuary.

attributes.action: Make employers test for cannabis using the saliva test rather than urine.
attributes.background: The urine test for cannabis is thought to be able to detect cannabis taken from upto 2-3 months prior to the test. This is a massive issue as cannabis has no impairment on your work even a day later. The saliva test used by police for roadside testing only detects cannabis taken that day.
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis is used worldwide as medication and although it could affect the way in which you work, the effects wear off after a few hours.

The test for alcohol in a work place can only detect alcohol taken that day or the day before therefore, the same should apply to cannabis.

Unemployment is already a massive issue in the UK and these tests only make it more difficult for people to maintain their employment wether they use recreationally or for medical purposes.

attributes.action: Increase the horsepower of motorcycles to 90bhp for an A2 License holder.
attributes.background: Objective is to increase BHP on a motorcycle for those who ride on an A2 license (19 years of age)
attributes.additional_details: Its unfair that car users, after passing their driving practical exam at 17 years of age can go a buy any car they want (assuming they can afford it , e.g  Ferrari, BMW or any higher performance vehicle) whereas a motorycles user cannot ride anything over 47bhp (A2 license) until they are 21 or 24 years of age. Those who misbehave and abuse such a privillege (if changes commence) must accept and deal with the consequences even if it results in their own injury/death

attributes.action: We demand that the government guarantees adequate future funding for the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is in dire risk of future collapse, due primarily to the pressure of inadequate funding from the government. We ask this and future governments to guarantee that the NHS will continue to be a free and full health service, and to commit to funding levels set by an independent expert body.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37331350

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35653455

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/sep/10/hospitals-on-brink-of-collapse-say-health-chiefs

http://metro.co.uk/2016/09/11/nhs-is-at-tipping-point-as-hospitals-struggle-with-severe-lack-of-funds-6121127/

http://www.itv.com/news/2016-09-11/cash-strapped-hospitals-face-unpalatable-choices-over-care-levels-warns-nhs-chief/

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/08/25/glut-of-nhs-closures-ahead-warn-hospital-chiefs/

attributes.action: Make compulsory DNA testing in order to reduce crime a law
attributes.background: dna helps the police find criminals faster and more efficiently. in order to do this they need to take one mouth swab sample of everyone in the country. This may have negative effects on example would be privacy. But would you give a sample of your dna to keep you and your friends and family safe.

attributes.action: Ask MP's to permanently relocate Parliament to a site in the middle of the UK
attributes.background: This represents a one off window of opportunity to move our primary democratic institution, the House of Commons, to a new site where MP's will be closer to real people and not the Metropolitan elite that dominates their mindset, processes and practices.
attributes.additional_details: It would represent a new start for our democracy, fit for the 21st Century and force our politicians to reassess and challenge the status quo.

attributes.action: Making it easier for adults to be diagnosed with autism
attributes.background: Having been diagnosed with autism in my adult life, which was not easy to do, I want to help adults get help being diagnosed a lot easier

attributes.action: MAKE THE SPOUSAL VISA REQUIREMENTS ACHIEVABLE! STOP MAKING PEOPLES LIVES SO HARD
attributes.background: It Is Far Too Hard For People To Earn £18'600 Per Annum! Let Alone Have Savings Of £62'000! It Is Pathetic!!
attributes.additional_details: I Have Friends And Family Struggling Because Of This And It Is Just Not Right!!!

attributes.action: Make premium rate text services need physical signature on terms and charges.
attributes.background: Premium rate text services send you a text message on your mobile and when you reply/text stop, you get charged without knowing charges or terms and conditions of service. Mobile operators charge on their behalf and you can't contact these premium rate text providers.
attributes.additional_details: It's happening all too often and to vulnerable people. Make it must for premium rate text services providers to get physical signature of billpayers on charges , terms and conditions for these services.

attributes.action: Government to reform the honours system to include posthumous awards
attributes.background: I'm creating this petition to call upon the Government to reform the honours system, so that knighthoods can be awarded posthumously. Its a shame that people that have contributed something for the country but are sadly no longer with us cannot be recognised for their achievements.
attributes.additional_details: A prime example is Bobby Moore. Its now the 50th anniversary of the year of England winning the world cup. He was a leader, a gentleman and credit to this country. Geoff Hurst has been knighted so surely Bobby Moore should be too (posthumously) as he was the Captain of the team, especially in this anniversary year. It would be a very fitting way to celebrate the achievement of the the man and the team.

attributes.action: Scrap the 30 hours childcare education funding & apply 20 hours on higher rates!
attributes.background: All early years setting are being given a rate for this 30hours that they cannot remain open with. Why not increase the hourly rates to improve quality in the sector so we can pay our staff better wages? Also provide 20 hours?
attributes.additional_details: Over the past year the sector has seen a drastic price increase of out goings to pensions, living wage and corporate tax. Also paying for staff DBS checks, training for paediatric first aid, first aid at work & food hygiene. All requirements that are set out by the statutory framework for us to run safe and secure settings. Living wage will be increasing in April how is this going to be paid for? This will come at the cost of quality, a big decline in careers and people leaving the profession!

attributes.action: Term Time Job Contracts for Parents
attributes.background: Term time jobs will allow thousands of parents to work and be at home with their children during school holidays. This should be accessible for parents with children aged 5-16
attributes.additional_details: Enforcing companies to employ a ratio of term time contracts dependant on staff numbers will allow parents to return to work and still take care of their children. This will get many people off of benefits and back into work. Many lone parents such as myself want to work but also want to be at home while our children are young to raise them and spend quality time with them. Students could be placed on temporary contracts during school holidays to fill the term time contractors.

attributes.action: Stop the formal testing of children at primary school in the UK.
attributes.background: Stop the UK Government from forcing primary schools to subject our young children to regular formal testing. It is no longer just SAT's in year 2 and 6. Children are now forced three times per academic year to go through week long tests carried out like formal exams with exam papers and time limits.
attributes.additional_details: There is no evidence that subjecting young children to these formal test situations improves academic achievement. There is however a lots of evidence that mental health issues, depression, stress and anxiety are increasing in our children and young people. There is also much evidence around the importance of play and physical exercise especially for primary age children. So why is the UK Government forcing schools to subject our children to these formal exam situations? Help protect childhood.

attributes.action: Make vaccinations for Meningitis B available to all babies and children!
attributes.background: After seeing another child lost to meningitis B in the news we need to address that there is a vaccination available for £155 but the government won't routinely provide it to our children. We need to change this, the government must act on this now-too many lives have been lost, let's prevent more!
attributes.additional_details: How can the government put a price on our children's lives?!

attributes.action: Regulate the use of all plastics in the UK. Through a license system.
attributes.background: Many uses of plastics are unnecessary and irresponsible, the regulation should include packaging. All plastics Produced in the UK or Imported should require a license. Necessary use such as Medical and certain foods are acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
All plastic bags should be banned other than those used for hygiene purposes and waste disposal, which should be clear, transparent bags.
This will reduce the need for recycling and lower pollution. It will also mean a responsible approach to the use of resources.

attributes.action: Apply VAT on airfares to better fund the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is underfunded; at the end of 2015/16 the NHS had a deficit of £1.85 billion. Aviation is lightly taxed but harmful, eg it impairs children's learning ability and is detrimental to wildlife. It is also exacerbating our climate crisis and in 2014 produced over 11% of the UK’s total emissions.
attributes.additional_details:
Airline passengers do not pay fuel duty or VAT and APD can be as low as £13. We might think this makes annual holidays affordable but in fact undertaxed flights largely benefit affluent people who fly several times a year; 70% of flights are taken by only 15% of adults.

My petition is to apply VAT on airfares and for the additional revenue to be used to support our NHS. Most of us like an annual holiday but those of us who can afford 2 to 3 holidays each year can also afford to pay more tax.

attributes.action: Modify the petition system to force Parliament debate of >100,000 signatures
attributes.background:
The present UK Government and Parliament petition system states that 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be considered for debate in Parliament."

This appears to be deliberately vague about who, and on what criteria, fair consideration will be given.

Remove "considered for"
attributes.additional_details:
The present UK Government and Parliament petition system states that 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be considered for debate in Parliament."

This appears to be deliberately vague about who, and on what criteria, fair consideration will be given.

Rewrite as 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be debated in Parliament."

attributes.action: Give clear statement about the post-brexit future of EU citizens
attributes.background: I'd like Theresa May to finally give a clear statement about the post-brexit future of EU citizens who've been living and working in the UK for many years. Their future is now one big question mark and people need to know what's going to happen to them. For many UK became home and only place to live
attributes.additional_details: Since the start of brexit campaign the subject of EU citizens living and working in UK has beed avoided and so far there are only questions and no answers at all. People made UK their homes, have jobs, children (who often are british citizens), bought their first houses and settled in. Now this all is one big question mark and people fear that their lives can be turned upside down within two years time.

attributes.action: Points removed by DVLA should be erased by insurance companies at the same time.
attributes.background: Insurance companies hold on to points which have been removed by the DVLA for an extra year and are pumping up the price of insurance or refusing insurance altogether. I believe this is legalised theft and totally unfair.
attributes.additional_details: On 21st December 2012, I got caught without insurance by a technicality: I believed that I was insured but had missed a payment,  unknown to me Ellephant Insurance cancelled it without telling me. My payday was the next day and I had plans to pay then anyway so I would have found out. As a result I got an in 10.  6 points which stay on the licence for 4 years pumping up car insurance by lots and lots of money. (I STILL BELIEVE IT WAS NOT MY FAULT).  So 4 years have passed and still my car insurance is sky high as all the insurance companies keep it on record and used it against us for an extra year. THIS IS WRONG! THIS MUST CHANGE NOW!

attributes.action: Give the people of the UK a veto (by referendum) of any trade deal
attributes.background:
The withdrawal of the UK from the EU will leave us in a position where unsafe trade deals could be made threatening the sovereignty of the UK over governance and standards of products and services.
The people of the UK need a deciding voice in any deal before it is enacted

attributes.action: Balance the petition system by allowing people to sign both for and against.
attributes.background:
I'm calling for the petition system to take both for and against votes while retaining the 100,000 signatures needed. 
This way overall public opinion will drive the need for a response or parliamentary debate. 
The current system does not give a voice to those people who agree with something.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Theresa May as PM over withheld information on Trident
attributes.background: The Commons voted to renew the £2.9b/year Trident nuclear missile program. We, the taxpayers, respect the outcome of democracy. However, if Theresa May made clear that Trident had malfunctioned, the result of the vote may have changed. Impeach the PM for dishonesty and a disservice to the people.
attributes.additional_details:
https://youtu.be/0WlVMeIEYpk
The PM repeatedly avoided a clear question on this issue, providing no reassurance to the public or the Commons about the safety of Trident.
The Trident Comission estimates that £2.9 billion will be spent annually on Trident. If it is not in working order, it poses a massive risk to the world, as well as being a waste of taxpayers' money.

attributes.action: Provide funding to migrate all NHS systems from Windows XP for security reasons
attributes.background: Barts NHS trust has just been hit with a ransomware attack, it was running Windows XP. 30 percent of all NHS trusts have been hit by ransomware according to an FOI request by Sentinel One. Moving off Windows XP is efficient, Imperial College NHS Trust found they cut help desk calls by 60 percent.
attributes.additional_details:
Upgrade from Windows XP would be a good start but proper endpoint security is needed to protect against ransomware. Dynamic endpoint protection and DNS level filtering. Anti malware and anti exploit protection is also necessary. 
http://www.computing.co.uk/ctg/news/3002565/barts-nhs-trust-windows-xp-pcs-infected-with-suspected-ransomware 
http://www.dclsearch.com/nhs-trusts-a-magnet-for-ransomware-foi-disclosures-reveal-it-security-news/ 
http://www.theregister.co.uk/2017/01/17/nhs_ransomware/

attributes.action: Change the law from late miscarriage to stillbirth.
attributes.background: I myself have had a stillbirth at 34 weeks just 9 month ago and I was outraged to discover that any children born before 24 weeks are categorised as a miscarriage. I want this changed.
attributes.additional_details: Many people don't realise that at this time the mother must give birth to their baby which is often fully formed. They hold them, love them and name them and yet they are non existent is the eyes of the law. They will not be offered a birth or death certificate or a funeral. This is heart breaking for the parents and family. I would like the law changed from miscarriage to still birth from the day any mother has to physically give birth to a baby.

attributes.action: Ban use of satellite navigation visual aids for black cab and private hire trade
attributes.background: Public safety should not be abused by allowing drivers of black cabs and private hire vehicles the elevated chance of being distracted and a danger to person or property whislt operating a vehicle and satellite navigation simultaneously whislt booked. Dont keep loved ones at risk with that booking.
attributes.additional_details: As stated on the gov.uk website under the policy paper regarding improving the driving test updated 25 August 2015, demonstrates there is evidence in the government's view to explore both the correlation between distrations, the causes of accidents and the need to perhaps introduce a baseline standard for drivers to demonstrate the ability to use satellite navigation safely. The general public in the interim of findings should be risk protected. Use of sat nav should be customer opt in only.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of hard wired electrical accessories to the general public.
attributes.background: Many house fires and potentially dangeous situations regarding the electeical installations in dwellings are caused by poor workmanship on electrical installations. The main reason for this is due to the availability of hard wired accessories to the general public, who then fit them themselves
attributes.additional_details: Many people will not touch the plumbing in thier house due to the possibility of a leak thus causing damage, but will happily tamper with the electrical installation of their own homes and sometimes others as they believe they know what they are doing but in reality, do not have the slightest clue and are totally incompetent to touch such systems. These people are putting peoples lives at risk everyday and are able to do so as anybody can purchase the equipment without proof of competence to fit

attributes.action: Ban pheasant shooting - a cruel, senseless 'sport'.
attributes.background: Living in the countryside, we sadly witness repeated pheasant shoots taking place right before our eyes. Despite what they say, the pheasants more often than not die in a slow, painful manner often landing in our garden whilst still alive, in agony, dying slowly.This so-called 'sport' needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Repeated pheasant shoots take place across the UK, but I am speaking from personal experience of it happening in North Lincolnshire, more often than not without any prior notice given.

The pheasants are bred, released into the surrounding area, then shot repeatedly by people who enjoy killing animals for fun.

The pheasants are often mauled while still alive by dogs and/or write in agony as they land on the ground.

This is inhumane and needs to be stopped as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Public enquiry:Investigate state of prisons. Bring British Army in to help staff
attributes.background: Prison staff are unable to cope with the safe running of our prisons. Staff and inmates safety must be priority. Promises of more staff have not been fulfilled. More training is needed for prison roles. Health and safety practice is poor. Begin a public enquiry. In the meantime; bring in our Army.
attributes.additional_details: Inmates rehabilitation is not to the standards that they could be. Inmates need guidance. The ratio of inmates per staff member is unreasonable. Thus, staff suffer and potentially risk their safety. Prison staff are over-worked and not paid enough in light of the work that they undertake. Inmates are often not in receipt of adequate care. The lack of rehabilitation of offenders affects all parts of our society. It is time to stop ignoring inmates and staff members needs.

attributes.action: National insurance should pay for old peoples care, not council tax
attributes.background:
Council tax is a blunt tool, not related to income, and therefore ability to pay.
Many councils are in financial trouble, because of the squeeze from government, and inflationary pressures.
Government can redistribute cash to the areas that need it. leaving the councils to deal with local issues

attributes.action: Make it illegal for office buildings to keep interior lighting on after hours.
attributes.background: Whilst out and about London recently on a Saturday night, I was struck by how many empty office buildings were lit up across the city with nobody at their desks. This is a massive waste of energy and resources and flies in the face of the Government commitment to reducing carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Make audio recording in meetings about children and vunerable adults mandatory.
attributes.background:
Children, vulnerable adults and their carers are suffering. 
I am concerned about neglect, lying and professional backwatching in schools and care services. All meetings should be audio recorded and a copy given to those discussed, their carer and all attendees.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/12/10/parents-allowed-record-child-protection-meetings/

Producing copies of an audio recording for all involved in meetings within the care/education system would reduce abusive behaviour, unprofessionalism, lying, inaccuracies and would help to stop recordings taken out of context and placed on social media.
No more hiding behind 'their word against ours'. Let's have proper transparency when it comes to our children's wellbeing and protecting our vulnerable.

attributes.action: Introduce a 'Safe Haven' law for abandoned babies in the UK
attributes.background: Around 500 babies are abandoned each year in the UK, that's 9 a week! Here in the UK its currently illegal to leave a baby in a safe place if the parent feels they can no longer look after them, but in all 50 states of America they have a 'Safe haven' law to protect vulnerable children and parents
attributes.additional_details:
The safe haven law allows unharmed children under 3 weeks of age to be surrendered anonymously and safely to a designated place with no questions asked. This insures that babies are not abandoned in cold or dangerous conditions or worse still neglected. 
Whilst this is a highly emotive issue, this law will not encourage pregnant women to abandon their children, what it will do is protect societies most venerable and those that need it most the babies. Please help me protect the these babies.

attributes.action: Make Universal Credit an optional benefit.
attributes.background: Many people will find they get less under Universal Credit than they would have done under one of the previous benefits that it replaces. While Universal Credit has a transfer top up amount up amount this will not do anything to help new claimants out in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Therefor it would be reasonable to request that the government does NOT make Universal Credit the only option by allowing people to choose either Universal Credit or the benefits that apply to them out of the 6 benefits that Universal Credit replaces.

attributes.action: Make universal credit phone numbers free
attributes.background: Sign this because it is ridiculous to phone up for help with benefits and money and to have a huge phone bill at the end!

attributes.action: Open Centres that provide Class A drugs like Heroin for free to prevent crime.
attributes.background: If there were Centers that provided class A drugs for free and a safe place to take them. Users Registered, agreed to treatment. Then Drug dealers would have no business, muggings, robberies and shoplifting would drop dramatically and few young people would start using.
attributes.additional_details: Open centres across the country. While keeping the sale and use of Heroin illegal elsewhere, in the Centres Heroin and other highly addictive class A drugs would be given to addicts that register and seek treatment. Over night drug dealers would be out of business, muggings, robbery’s, burglary’s and shop lifting would decrease dramatically as addicts no longer need to commit crime. Lastly, drug dealers wouldn’t be pushing drugs onto young naïve people in order to profit from their misery.

attributes.action: Change of Law: MPs must stand down after serving a constituency for 10 years.
attributes.background: Nearly 10% of current UK MPs have been active for over 25 years. Nearly 20% of MPs have been active for over 20 years. The world has changed vastly since 1996, yet nearly 1/5 of MPs have been serving since then. Excessive continuous service prevents real political change for the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Rt Hon. Sir Gerald Kaufman, The Rt Hon. Kenneth Clarke, The Rt Hon. Michael Meacher & Dennis Skinner have been active since 1970 - nearly 37 years making decisions for our country. The term 'Father of the House' is unsettling. We should be a progressive country, not a frozen one. Change is healthy. Fresh ideas and fresh actions are needed now more than ever.

attributes.action: Private companies must allow 10 minutes before issue of a parking invoice.
attributes.background: Many retail parks, housing developments and busimesses use private parking companies to control parking in their carparks or roads. We believe these companies should be legally required to allow the driver to overstay by a maximum of ten minutes, just as traffic wardens and council wardens have to.
attributes.additional_details: If you are held up at the till because there are not enough staff at the checkouts, is it fair to be charged by the parking company that the store employs? Is it right to receive a ticket because you pulled up at your door to unload shopping before taking your car to the official car park? No, it isn't. These charges are exhorbitant and unfair. They should have to allow at least a few minutes grace before pouncing and issuing a fine.

attributes.action: A 2nd EU Referendum to be held with Compulsory Voting for the Eligible.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to Conduct a 2nd Referendum with Compulsory voting  for all who are eligible, with an abstention option on the ballot paper. This will give a true majority of the UK voters wishes regarding the EU and a true mandate to Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The British Election Study asked a question on whether people regretted how they voted or not. Only 1% of people who voted Remain said they regretted their vote, but 6% of people who voted Leave said they regretted their vote.

attributes.action: Release Sharbat Gula
attributes.background:
The “Afghan Girl” who graced an iconic cover of National Geographic magazine in 1985 has been arrested in Pakistan on charges of being in the country illegally.

I call upon the UK government to ask for an immediate release of Sharbat Gula.

I request everyone to sign and share the petition.
attributes.additional_details: Sharbat Gula was 12 years old when she was photographed by Steve McCurry in a refugee camp in Pakistan, in December 1984. The haunting image of the green-eyed girl became an international symbol of refugees and of political and social unrest in the region. It has been widely reproduced, making her one of the most recognizable non-celebrity faces of the 20th century.

attributes.action: make the dartford tunnel/crossing free when traffic jams are a mile back.
attributes.background:
To make the dartford tunnel/crossing free when tailback/traffic jams are a mile back.
We shouldn't have to pay for something that should've been free years ago.
The highways agency and sanef should sort this out.
Doing away with the barriers has made traffic tailbacks worse!

attributes.action: Allow existing annuities to be transferred into another existing private pension
attributes.background: Government has cancelled previous intention to allow annuities to be sold.

attributes.action: As with perjury, hold politicians in contempt of the realm if they lie publicly.
attributes.background:
Perjury: the offence of wilfully telling an untruth or making a misrepresentation under oath.
If you lie in court you can be sentenced to a term of imprisonment of up to 7 years. 
If you are a politician however, who lies under oath religiously to the public, then you usually receive a promotion.
attributes.additional_details:
We have recently seen the effect of such lies told to the country, yet those responsible for their gross misrepresentations continue to enjoy their profession having never been held legally accountable for the horrendous damage caused by their deceitful rhetoric. 

Make lying to the public, whilst in office, the same offence as lying in court.

attributes.action: Raise awareness about Motorcyclist for drivers. Add a Section for Practical test
attributes.background:
Many Car drivers are not very aware of Motorcyclist. I have seen many fatal accidents and it is now time to raise awareness for learners and normal drivers.
If they fail to show any awareness about Motorcyclist they must retake their test.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for food outlets to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background:
In the uk it is not a legal requirement for food outlets to display their food hygiene ratings. 
 

Many people don't know that you can check online, many people assume the government wouldn't allow somewhere to be open if they received 0-1-2 stars. 

But they are aloud to stay open.
attributes.additional_details:
Check out local places in your area. 
http://ratings.food.gov.uk

My local chicken shop received a 0..
Local Costcutter received a 1
Local Cafe received a 1
All are still open.

Major improvements required
System or checks in place to ensure that food sold or served is safe to eat, the food safety officer has confidence that standards will be maintained in future.

Cleanliness and condition of facilities and building to enable good food hygiene.

http://www.youtube.com/user/FoodStandardsAgency

attributes.action: Review the Council Tax system so that it reflects individual contributions
attributes.background: I believe that the current Council Tax system is outdated and unfair - taxing households rather than individuals - Why should single households pay almost as much as a 5 occupancy household, why should a property worth millions pay same as a council flat?
attributes.additional_details:
Tax should be paid on individual bases and proportional to each person burden to the local authority - Should 2 pensionnaires household pay same council tax as a family of 5? Should a single working professional pay towards services it does not currently use?
Also with property valuation completely changed from 25 years ago - should household taxation still be considered an option? 
On top of that local councils have constantly risen tax/year and discrepancies between boroughs are huge.

attributes.action: Reduce the Foreign Aid budget and use the monies to fund Social Housing
attributes.background: Reduce the Foreign Aid Budget and use the monies to fund a Social Housing scheme to ensure all UK Veterans and homeless families have somewhere safe to live.  Any monies left can also fund Social Housing for the rest of the Country and then use the rents raised towards upkeep.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory driving licence re-testing for old age pensioners
attributes.background:
It has been shown numerous times that old age causes lowered reflexes and reaction times. This has been reflected in the high level of accidents and poor driving from pensioners.

To maintain the standards of driving on UK roads, I propose mandatory re-testing above a certain age (perhaps ~70).
attributes.additional_details:
Here's is the most recent example of many: 

"Eight car pile-up after elderly driver goes wrong way down motorway"

http://metro.co.uk/2016/08/31/eight-car-pile-up-after-elderly-driver-goes-wrong-way-down-motorway-6101485/#ixzz4IzPn56B6

Studies suggest that older drivers are no more dangerous than young drivers, but it is scientifically certain that old age results in degradation of the senses. As such, it stands to reason that there is a point when driving is no longer a safe endeavour.

attributes.action: Lower the age to 20 for women to have smear tests.
attributes.background: After today, reading of another young mum dying of cervical cancer because she was to young to have a smear test I decided to start this petition so we can fight for a change in the age that smears are routinely offered. I believe at the very least the age should be lowered to 20.

attributes.action: Change the definition of rape to cover forceful envelopment of a penis or digit
attributes.background: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 defines rape as the penetration of the vagina, anus or mouth of another person with a penis. By this definition, a woman cannot rape a man or another woman. The law should be changed to include the forceful envelopment of a penis or digit

attributes.action: Stronger sentences for paedophilia.
attributes.background: we're looking into making it law that individuals who commit paedophilia & are found guilty are not allowed to live within a radius of 1000 feet of a school or playground. Due to a recent conviction of a paedophile who lives very close to a primary school in a residential area.
attributes.additional_details: Due to a recent conviction of a paedophile who lives very close to a primary school in a residential area. Who got a incredibly light sentence of 8 months suspended over 2 years for viewing images and videos of children from babies upwards. In America it is law that any convicted sex offender is not to live within 1000 feet of a school we feel this should aslo be a law in the UK.
attributes.creator_name: dominic and coralie james & paul and kelly wait
